subSections.title: Etymology
subSections.text: From {{inh|zh|sit-pro|*hal||to snore}}. Compare {{cog|bo|ཧལ||to pant; to wheeze; to snort; to snore}}.

subSections.title: Readings
Etymology 1
Derived terms
Etymology 2
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|いびき}}
Originally a compound of {{compound|ja|sort=いびき|息|tr1=i|t1=breath, breathing|引き|tr2=hiki|t2=pulling, drawing|pos2=the {{m|ja|連用形|tr=ren'yōkei||continuative or stem form}} of verb {{m|ja|引く}} ''hiku'' “to pull, to draw”}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref> {{rendaku2|sort=いびく|hiki|biki}}

subSections.title: Derived terms
Usage notes
subSections.text: The verb sense “to snore” is more commonly expressed using the verbal phrases {{lang|ja|鼾}}{{m|ja|を}}{{m|ja|掻く|tr=ibiki o kaku|lit=to make a snoring sound}} or {{lang|ja|鼾}}{{m|ja|を}}{{m|ja|立てる|tr=ibiki o tateru|lit=to raise a snore, to put up a snore}}.

subSections.title: Etymology 3
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=kun|くつち}}
Apparently the {{m|ja|連用形|tr=ren'yōkei||continuative or stem form}} of obsolete verb {{m|ja|鼾つ|tr=kutsutsu||to sleep while snoring|pos=possibly [[onomatopoeic]]}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

The {{m|en|epilepsy}} sense may have arisen from how one's breathing may be [[spastic]] and vaguely similar to [[snoring]] when suffering an [[epileptic]] [[seizure]].

However, the conjugation of this [[putative]] verb is unknown, and it is only encountered in what would be the [[nominalize]]d {{m|ja|連用形|tr=ren'yōkei||continuative or stem form}} of ''kutsuchi''.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref> This leaves open the possibility of alternative origins:

* May be a compound of {{compound|ja|sort=くつち|口|tr1=kutsu|t1=mouth|pos1=the bound form of modern {{m|ja|口|tr=kuchi}}, only found in compounds|風|tr2=chi|t2=wind|pos2=from the way that snoring often happens when breathing through the mouth, or from the way that an [[epileptic]] [[seizure]] may involve [[spastic]] breathing vaguely similar to snoring}}.
* The {{m|en|epilepsy}} sense may be a compound of {{compound|ja|sort=くつち|口|tr1=kutsu|t1=mouth|pos1=the bound form of modern {{m|ja|口|tr=kuchi}}, only found in compounds|血|tr2=chi|t2=blood|pos2=from the common occurrence of biting one's tongue during an [[epileptic]] [[seizure]]}}.
